title: Eastern North Carolina Weather Alert: Storm Chances Build Saturday Through Tuesday
text:
Newport, N.C. – Storm chances are set to increase across coastal North Carolina as Labor Day weekend approaches, with scattered thunderstorms possible from Saturday afternoon through Tuesday. While dry weather dominates today and Friday, unsettled skies could disrupt holiday plans beginning this weekend.
According to the National Weather Service, Newport can expect highs in the low to mid-80s with humid conditions persisting. A slight chance of storms arrives Saturday after 2 p.m., growing to a 30% chance by Sunday afternoon. Thunderstorms are expected to remain possible each day through Tuesday, particularly during the late afternoon and evening hours.
Locally heavy rain and brief gusty winds could impact outdoor events, especially along U.S. Highway 70 and nearby beach towns. Travelers are advised to plan around pop-up storms and keep an eye on changing skies before heading out.
Friday looks to be the sunniest stretch of the weekend with calm conditions, making it the best day for boating or beach trips before storm chances ramp up. By Monday and Tuesday, scattered thunderstorms may bring on-and-off delays for barbecues, travel, and outdoor gatherings.
Storm chances remain in the forecast through midweek, meaning updates and advisories may follow as conditions develop.
Five Day Forecast for Newport, NC
- Friday: Sunny, high near 84. Calm wind becoming southwest 5–7 mph.
- Saturday: Mostly sunny, high near 85. Slight chance of storms after 2 p.m.
- Sunday: Mostly sunny, high near 82. Afternoon storms possible, 30% chance.
- Labor Day (Monday): Partly sunny, high near 81. Scattered thunderstorms, 30% chance.
- Tuesday: Partly sunny, high near 81. Storm chances continue, 30%.
